metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2185 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
The ati_remote2_probe function in drivers/input/misc/ati_remote2.c in theLinux kernel before 4.5.1 allows physically proximate attackers to cause adenial of service (NULL pointer dereference and system crash) via a craftedendpoints value in a USB device descriptor.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2185` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-22.39
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-22.39
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-22.39
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1010-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1010.12
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1013-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1013.14
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-22.39').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1010.12').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1013.14').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-gke package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
